theskinnyconfidential
KIMKELLYFIT
Fill out the Daily Life Chart each day to track your wellness habits!
DOWNLOAD YOUR DAILY HABITS CHART
Breakfast

KIM & LAURYN NEVER SKIP BREAKFAST. Two & half hours later is always a snack. They both love fiber, protein, greens, & LIGHT, healthy fat. Make sure you\'re eating enough to rev up your metabolism. When you go long stretches of time without food, you\'re slowing down your metabolism. You don\'t want to train your body to store fat. SO eat. Especially breakfast. It sets the tone of the day.
Self-Care

Lauryn & Kim LOVE SELF-CARE. This can be anything from meditation, chiropractor, acupuncture, cupping, massage, facials, hot bath, aromatherapy, rosé (HAHA), listening podcasts, reading, etc. When you\'re your best self, you can show up for other\'s better. Self-care is SO IMPORTANT.

Lauryn likes to aim for 7 to 9 and Kim likes to get 7 to 8 hours. Sleep is SO IMPORTANT. Get in bed & unplug at least an hour before. Lauryn likes to read a hard-cover book before bed & Kim likes to listen to music or meditate. They both like noise-canceling headphones too (so Lauryn can avoid Michael\'s 384732 questions).
Water

We know, we know- this is what everyone tells you BUT it\'s important. Aim for half your body weight in ounces. Kim & Lauryn carry around a Hydroflask (Lauryn especially loves her pink Starbucks cup). Both of them keep the water cold which is ideal. Get creative with your water- use non-caffeinated tea, add mint, lemon, berries, or basil (Lauryn loves basil in her water, Kim loves basil & strawberries in her water). Even freezing berries in ice & adding them to your water feels special. If you\'re not into water, set alarms in your phone to remind you to GULPY-GULP. If you\'re drinking, have a glass of water for every cocktail! ALWAYS. Try for non-bubbly if you\'re drinking alcohol. Lauryn LOVES PEPPERMINT TEA. Lately she\'s been doing mint leaves in hot water. This soothes the digestive system. Kim loves a straw because it\'s easier to drink. The Hydroflask has a straw built in & Lauryn loves SoftyStraws too. Water-based foods like cucumber, lettuce, & watermelon are great too.
Sex

Sex is a mood-lifting hormone! Get in sex when you can- HA. It\'s your feel good hormone. If you can\'t have sex, 2018 is all about the self-love. Have some fun. We both love coconut oil based lube like WOO FOR PLAY.
Steps

Lauryn likes to count her steps on the PACER APP. Kim likes her Apple watch. Both are great. They both like to aim for 10k minimum a day, but 15k is a goal (very ideal!). Lauryn likes to get her steps in on the Treadmill while returning e-mails. Kim likes to park far away from where she has to go. Kim also likes to walk her dog while on a conference call. Be resourceful!
Sweat
This is obvious. TRY TO BREAK A SWEAT ONCE A DAY. 7 minute workouts count!
Fill out the Daily Life Chart each day to track your wellness habits!
DOWNLOAD YOUR DAILY HABITS CHART
15 BEST PLANT-BASED PROTEIN SOURCES
GREEN PEACE
QUINOA
NUTS AND BETTERS
BEANS
CHECKPEAS
TEMPEH AND TOFU
EDAMAME
LEAFY GREENS
HEMP
CHIA SEEDS
SESAMR, SUNFLOWER, AND POPPY SEEDS
SEITAN
NON-DAIRY MILK
UNSWEETENED COCOA POWDER
Avoid
+ soy - full of GOs linked to disease
+ dairy,if vegan
+ addivives and processed ingredients
+ whey that is pasteurized and heat treated - disruptive to health
Look for
+ building muscle = whey & whey isolates, BCAAs
+ lose weight = no added sugars or maldextrons, no BCAAs
+ vegan - use plant proteins such as hemp or pea
+ a brand that tests for level of poisons
How & Why
+ post workout = consume protein within 30 minutes
+ muscles are most responsive for growth and repair during that time.
+ protein keeps body filled longer and doesn’t turn to fat.
+ spread out throughout the day - your body breaks down 25 g per meal
Example:
If you’re beginning to workout & weigh 125 lbs (~60 g protein / day)
+ Green smoothie ( 20 g )
+ Turkey salad lunch ( 25 g )
+ Chicken breast dinner ( 20 g )
Positive Talk
Time

YES — talking positively to yourself. Celebrate your victories — tiny ones AND large ones. \"I feel great! This is going to be awesome! I can’t wait to feel and look even more amazing! I got this!\" Keep pushing and FINISH! The way we talk to ourselves matters. MAKE IT ALL INSANELY POSITIVE. Remember your thoughts become your actions!

Schedule your workout like an appointment! Is it going to be first thing in the morning, during your lunch hour, when your kids are napping, after work? When? Put it in your phone, and DO NOT COMPROMISE!!! You don\'t miss your hair, nails or lash appointment, so you CERTAINLY are not going to miss your GET FIT appointment.
Consistency

Results come from work. True work! This means consistently putting in the effort when working and doing. Honor yourself and your health enough to make it a priority in your everyday life. Stick with the program and you\'ll see results.
Commitment

What is your WHY? Why are you committing to this program. What do you want from it? Where are you going? There’s got to be something in you that WANTS a change. Some kind of change. It doesn’t have to be physique — wise. Write it down & put it on your mirror. Maybe even make a vision board. VISUALIZE and COMMIT!
Preparation

Have everything ready to go! Try laying out your workout clothes the night before or even sleeping in them for those early mornings. Pack your gym bag and place it by the door. You can even text a friend to see if she can join. Give her the exact time and location. Go REGARDLESS of who else is joining!
Effort

OK — this may seem harsh, but you need to get a bit uncomfortable and learn to PUSH yourself! Know good pain vs. bad pain and accept it. Remember that famous quote, “Your mind will quit a thousand times before you body will. Feel the fear and do it anyway.”
Openness
Realistic

There will be MANY obstacles — get ready to hurdle them. Some days you may be exhausted, not feeling so great, upset, sad, anxious... guess what? Skipping the workout or eating a bunch of cookies won’t make those feelings better, most likely it will make them worse.

Be realistic about your time frame when looking for results. If you are consistently prepared, put in the time and effort, open-minded & committed to this program, it will work. We like to call it “stick and stay.”
GO TO THE COMMUNITY NOW
PRIVATE FACEBOOK TSC BODY GROUP

Kim and Lauryn will be checking in to touch base with everyone and to help you stay motivated!We are all in this together. Although these workouts will most likely be done solo in your home, backyard, garage or park, we want to hear from you!
CONNECT WITH US HERE
HOW TO JOIN:
open Facebook and search: The Skinny Confidential Body. click “JOIN.” Answer the question (what’s your e-mail) and we will match your e-mail with your order number.
MEMBERS ONLY
ACCESS NOW
WWW.THESKINNYCONFIDENTIAL.COM
THE SKINNY CONFIDENTIAL ON SOCIAL MEDIA
+ plus GIVEAWAYS
+ QUICK snacks of the day
+ our LATEST grocery store finds
+ NEW recipes
+ much more!
YOU WILL RECEIVE:
+ BONUS workouts. Think Arm Toner, Ab blaster, Booty Call, Tighter Thighs
WWW.KIMKELLYFIT.COM
KIM KELLY FIT ON SOCIAL MEDIA
HOW TO USE IT:
+ post pictures after you\'ve completed your workout
+ share your progress and struggles
+ show us what protein you\'re eating post workout
+ encourage others and find support to \"get it done\"
LET\'S SWEET

Your workouts can be invigorating, fun, challenging and rewarding in short amounts of time. Many of you have watched Lauryn’s Instagram & Snapchat stories regarding her weekly workouts. Kim has been training Lauryn for over a year now, and they both understand and relate to BUSY LIVES! We wanted to be able to share these creative, effective workouts with the entire community. NOW, you can do them with her. LET’S DO THIS!

You will workout 3 days a week. There will be 2 different circuits in EACH workout. Each circuit will have a stated number of reps to be done in 7 minutes. TRY NOT TO STOP for breaks during the 7 minutes. You may take 30-60 seconds rest before starting the circuit over again. Move on to Circuit 2 after you have completed Circuit 1 twice.
DAY ONE we will focus on Legs & Ass DAY TWO we will focus on Arms & Back DAY THREE we will do Full Shebang *don’t fret — every workout includes ABS + CARDIO.
We have also included TWO BONUS MINUTES for every workout. You will have a ONE MINUTE CARDIO burst choice and a ONE MINUTE PLANK VARIATION choice.
These workouts will be 28 minutes in total. You do Circuit One 2X at 7 min each and Circuit Two 2X at 7 min each. THEN, if you take the Cardio & Core challenge it will equal 30 MINUTES.

If you are tight on time on a particular day, we encourage you NOT TO SKIP your workout! You could always do one round of each circuit, which of course would total 14 minutes. We bet you can find at least 14 minutes in your busy day.
START WORKOUT
WHAT DO I DO ON DAYS I\'M NOT DOING TSC WORKOUT?
TRACK YOUR PROGRESS
HOW & WHEN TO TAKE PHOTOS & MEASUREMENTS
Lauryn & Kim recommend taking your photos every 2 weeks. This will help you track your gradual progression.
WHEN TAKING PHOTOS
1. Same setting each time and similar lighting
2. Same clothing (either bikini or jog bra and shorts)
3. Chin up, chest up & let hands naturally fall to your sides
4. Full length body shot
5. Shoot front, side and back (if possible)
WHEN TAKING MEASUREMENTS
*Use a loose measuring tape.
1. Wear either super tight fitted tank and leggings or bra and underwear, bathing suit or nothing at all!
2. Stand with feet together, chin up, chest up
CHEST
Wrap the tape around biggest part of the chest (right at center nipple).
WAIST
Wrap the tape around mid-waist so it wraps over belly button.
HIPS
Wrap the tape around the hips so it wraps around center of the buttocks.
THIGHS
You can do just one side. Separate legs apart, let your hands fall naturally at your sides, stand tall. Measure the circumference of your thigh wherever your thumb is naturally hitting your leg
INCREASE THE BURN
Well, here are some tips to BUMP UP YOUR BURN:
Want to make your workout more challenging, or maybe you\'re in week 3 or 4, feeling darn good and you\'re ready for more?
+ plank holds — try lifting one leg off ground half the time then switch sides.
+ LUNGES — 90 degree angle lunge on every rep.
+ SQUATS —90 degree bend in knee or even lower if knees permit.
+ TAKE LESS BREAKS in between sets — CONTINUOUS MOVEMENT!
+ gauge your intensity by the ability to answer a question. MOST of this workout you should be able to answer with 1 word MAX! KEEP IT INTENSE!
+ airplane mode for phone. only use technology for timing the workout. take pics and send to Lauryn & Kim AFTER you\'ve finished.
+ straighten your legs during tricep dips.
+ if you\'re nailing all exercises in time frame easily, then increase the rep count.
+ for plyometrics: push off the ground with more intensity (go higher) and land lower in your position.
+ go ALL THE WAY to the ground with your chest during any push up variation.
+ come off your knees during any push up variation.
+ add a push up to any type of burpee.
+ add a Versa Loop band over wrists during step ups, knee ups, jacknives (any situation where you don\'t have weights in your hands).
+ add a Versa Loop band on the thighs to any squat type of exercise.
+ adding weights to basically any exercise will increase the intensity.
If weather permits, outdoor activities of any sort – tennis, volleyball, beach games, dog walking, hiking, cycling, swimming.
GET OUTSIDE!
Stretch! We have provided several stretching options in this guide. Please take 10 minutes 4-6 times per week and choose 4-6 of these stretches (pg. 66). Hold each for minimum of 30 seconds.
STRETCH!
YOGA!
A nice, relaxing, restorative class can be great for the mind as well as the body.
Yes it matters! Walking, hiking, jogging and running - it all matters! Kim uses her Apple Watch and Lauryn uses her phone.
STEPS!
MEDITATION!
Aim for 3-5 times per week. Some do it daily - right on!
SHOP INGREDIENTS
Skip timer start workout
HELLO, HI, WHAT\'S UP ?!
YOU ARE HERE BECAUSE YOU\'RE CREATING YOUR OWN HEALTHY FUTURE.

But really, that\'s what it is: YOU OWNING YOUR LIFE & GOING AFTER IT. This guide is designed for the girl who wants to be the best version of themselves- someone who wants to be efficient but still has to go. What do I mean by GO? I mean you have to go- you\'re busy. It needs to be a quickie. We can\'t be cooking up a salmon every day over grilled, restaurant-worthy veggies. Time is money! Let\'s go, right? Sometimes the hustle & bustle can be overwhelming- trust me, I get it. Really though, this guide was designed for someone who has a similar lifestyle to me- someone who is slammed on time & wants something laid out in the most effective way possible. I GOT YOU. Well not just me - my trainer, KIM KELLY, too. Which is great because we love a RESOURCE! It\'s for the babe on the go, the girl who\'s late, the mom who\'s tired- no matter where you\'re starting from we have steps to get you to where you want to be. We’re talking FILLING, QUICK, SIMPLE, DELICIOUS recipes that will go with you from home, to the office, to date night. LOTS of skinny hacks. Supplement tips. Portion control talk. Workouts- but like ones you can do while watching Real Housewives. Again- everything is to the point. We don\'t screw around. Especially when it comes to your time.
OH & YES, you can have alcohol & sweets while still reaching for the stars.
YESSSS, YOU CAN HAVE IT ALL.
Ok, let\'s do this. It\'s kale, champagne, & squat time.
x, lauryn & kim LET’S SWEAT
Meet your workout partner:
LAURYN EVARTS BOSSTICK

Lauryn Evarts Bosstick is the creator of the blog, book and podcast The Skinny Confidential. It represents the movers, the shakers, and the ones who, without a doubt, want to be the best damn version of themselves. The Skinny Confidential is about living your best life with kale in one hand and champagne in the other. The Skinny Confidential has been featured in SHAPE, Women’s Health Magazine, The Huffington Post, SELF Magazine, & Who What Wear. She lives in Southern California with her husband, Michael & their two chihuahuas, Pixy and T. Boone Pickens. Lauryn created this guide to showcase all of her skinny tips and tricks.
Meet your trainer:
KIM KELLY

Kim Kelly is a lifestyle & fitness expert in San Diego. Drawing from her experience in an array of diverse training disciplines, Kim has developed a unique and powerful fitness regimen that focuses on high intensity interval training (HIIT). At the heart of her workouts are a creative and systematic series of cardio, strength and abdominal exercises designed to achieve full body results in a short time frame. Kim’s greatest joy not only comes from seeing her clients achieve their fitness and health goals but also watching their self confidence grow as a result. Her belief that positive energy has both physical and emotional benefits is at the core of her mission to INSPIRE & MOTIVATE PEOPLE…while keeping it FUN.
